docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 18 --With thirty-six of her crew buried on Uruguayan soil, the pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee, which Germany expected would revolutionize naval warfare, lay today in the mouth of the River Plate, a broken and twisted...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 18 --With thirty-six of her crew buried on Uruguayan soil, the pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee, which Germany expected would revolutionize naval warfare, lay today in the mouth of the River Plate, a broken and twisted mass of black and burning wreckage.
docs.abstract: Spee still aflame; near mutiny over sinking reptd; 4 crew members held by Uruguay; crew lands at Buenos Aires; to be interned

headline.main: GRAF SPEE'S CREW WILL BE INTERNED; Argentina's Foreign Office Acts as Langsdorff Lands --Wreckage Still Aflame Near Mutiny Reported GRAF SPEE'S CREW WILL BE INTERNED Not a Menace to Navigation Spee Sailors Are Detained Argentina to Intern Crew No Renewal of Struggle

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Dec. 18--Captain Hans Langsdorff told The Associated Press today that the Admiral Graf Spee, while preying on Allied merchant shipping, once disguised herself as the British battle cruiser Renown.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Dec. 18--Captain Hans Langsdorff told The Associated Press today that the Admiral Graf Spee, while preying on Allied merchant shipping, once disguised herself as the British battle cruiser Renown.

headline.main: Captain Says Graf Spee Sailed For a Time Disguised as Renown; THE DRAMATIC END OF THE ADMIRAL GRAF SPEE, SUNK BY HER OWN CAPTAIN

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 18--Six Chinese laundrymen of the Admiral Graf Spee's crew slept calmly through all the intense excitement and destruction of the German pocket battleship yesterday. As soon as they had been transferred aboard the German...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 18--Six Chinese laundrymen of the Admiral Graf Spee's crew slept calmly through all the intense excitement and destruction of the German pocket battleship yesterday. As soon as they had been transferred aboard the German cargo boat Tacoma they went below decks and went to sleep.
